verses.verse: There was a famine <S%H7458><s%> in the land, <S%H776><s%> besides <S%H905><s%> the first <S%H7223><s%> famine <S%H7458><s%> that was in the days <S%H3117><s%> of Abraham. <S%H85><s%> Isaac <S%H3327><s%> went <S%H3212><s%> to Abimelech <S%H40><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of the Philistines, <S%H6430><s%> to Gerar. <S%H1642><s%>

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> appeared <S%H7200><s%> to him, <S%H559><s%> and said, "Don't <S%H3381><s%> go down into Egypt. <S%H4714><s%> Live <S%H7931><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> I will tell you about. <S%H559><s%>

Live <S%H1481><s%> in this land, <S%H776><s%> and I will be with you, <S%H1288><s%> and will bless you. <S%H2233><s%> For to you, and to your seed, I will give <S%H5414><s%> all these <S%H411><s%> lands, <S%H776><s%> and I will establish <S%H6965><s%> the oath <S%H7621><s%> which I swore <S%H7650><s%> to Abraham <S%H85><s%> your father. <S%H1><s%>

I will <S%H7235><s%> multiply <S%H7235><s%> your seed <S%H2233><s%> as the stars <S%H3556><s%> of the sky, <S%H8064><s%> and will give <S%H5414><s%> to your seed <S%H2233><s%> all these <S%H411><s%> lands. <S%H776><s%> In your seed <S%H2233><s%> will all the nations <S%H1471><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> be blessed, <S%H1288><s%>

because <S%H6118><s%> Abraham <S%H85><s%> obeyed <S%H8085><s%> my voice, <S%H6963><s%> and kept <S%H8104><s%> my requirements, <S%H4931><s%> my commandments, <S%H4687><s%> my statutes, <S%H2708><s%> and my laws. <S%H8451><s%>"
Isaac <S%H3327><s%> lived <S%H3427><s%> in Gerar. <S%H1642><s%>

The men <S%H582><s%> of the place <S%H4725><s%> asked <S%H7592><s%> him about his wife. <S%H802><s%> He said, <S%H559><s%> "She is my sister, <S%H269><s%>" for he was afraid <S%H3372><s%> to say, <S%H559><s%> "My wife, <S%H802><s%>" lest, <S%H582><s%> he thought, "the men of the place <S%H4725><s%> might kill <S%H2026><s%> me for Rebekah, <S%H7259><s%> because she is beautiful <S%H2896><s%> to look at. <S%H4758><s%>"

It happened, <S%H748><s%> when he had been there a long time, <S%H3117><s%> that Abimelech <S%H40><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> looked out <S%H8259><s%> at <S%H1157><s%> a window, <S%H2474><s%> and saw, <S%H7200><s%> and, <S%H3327><s%> behold, Isaac was caressing <S%H6711><s%> Rebekah, <S%H7259><s%> his wife. <S%H802><s%>

Abimelech <S%H40><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> Isaac, <S%H3327><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Behold, <S%H389><s%> surely she is your wife. <S%H802><s%> Why did you say, <S%H559><s%> <S%H269><s%> 'She is my sister?'" Isaac <S%H3327><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H559><s%> "Because I said, <S%H4191><s%> 'Lest I die because of her.'"

Abimelech <S%H40><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "What is this you have done <S%H6213><s%> to us? <S%H259><s%> One of the people <S%H5971><s%> might easily <S%H4592><s%> have lain <S%H7901><s%> with your wife, <S%H802><s%> and you would have brought <S%H935><s%> guilt on us! <S%H817><s%>"

Abimelech <S%H40><s%> commanded <S%H6680><s%> all the people, <S%H5971><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "He who touches <S%H5060><s%> this man <S%H376><s%> or his wife <S%H802><s%> will surely <S%H4191><s%> be put to death. <S%H4191><s%>"

Isaac <S%H3327><s%> sowed <S%H2232><s%> in that land, <S%H776><s%> and reaped <S%H4672><s%> in the same year <S%H8141><s%> one hundred <S%H3967><s%> times what he planted. <S%H3068><s%> Yahweh blessed him. <S%H1288><s%>
The man <S%H376><s%> grew great, <S%H1431><s%> and grew <S%H1432><s%> more <S%H3212><s%> and more <S%H1980><s%> until he became <S%H1431><s%> very <S%H3966><s%> great. <S%H1431><s%>

He had possessions <S%H4735><s%> of flocks, <S%H6629><s%> possessions <S%H4735><s%> of herds, <S%H1241><s%> and a great <S%H7227><s%> household. <S%H5657><s%> The Philistines <S%H6430><s%> envied him. <S%H7065><s%>

Now all the wells <S%H875><s%> which his father <S%H1><s%>'s servants <S%H5650><s%> had dug <S%H2658><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> of Abraham <S%H85><s%> his father, <S%H1><s%> the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> had stopped, <S%H5640><s%> and filled <S%H4390><s%> with earth. <S%H6083><s%>
Abimelech <S%H40><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Isaac, <S%H3327><s%> "Go <S%H3212><s%> from us, <S%H3966><s%> for you are much mightier than we. <S%H6105><s%>"
Isaac <S%H3327><s%> departed <S%H3212><s%> from there, <S%H2583><s%> encamped in the valley <S%H5158><s%> of Gerar, <S%H1642><s%> and lived <S%H3427><s%> there. <S%H8033><s%>

Isaac <S%H3327><s%> dug <S%H2658><s%> again <S%H7725><s%> the wells <S%H875><s%> of water, <S%H4325><s%> which they had dug <S%H2658><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> of Abraham <S%H85><s%> his father. <S%H1><s%> For the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> had stopped <S%H5640><s%> them after <S%H310><s%> the death <S%H4194><s%> of Abraham. <S%H85><s%> He called <S%H7121><s%> their names <S%H8034><s%> after the names <S%H8034><s%> by which <S%H834><s%> his father <S%H1><s%> had called them. <S%H7121><s%>
Isaac <S%H3327><s%>'s servants <S%H5650><s%> dug <S%H2658><s%> in the valley, <S%H5158><s%> and found <S%H4672><s%> there a well <S%H875><s%> of springing <S%H2416><s%> water. <S%H4325><s%>

The herdsmen <S%H7462><s%> of Gerar <S%H1642><s%> argued <S%H7378><s%> with Isaac <S%H3327><s%>'s herdsmen, <S%H7462><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "The water <S%H4325><s%> is ours. <S%H7121><s%>" He called the name <S%H8034><s%> of the well <S%H875><s%> Esek, <S%H6230><s%> because they contended with him. <S%H6229><s%>
They dug <S%H2658><s%> another <S%H312><s%> well, <S%H875><s%> and they argued <S%H7378><s%> over that, <S%H7121><s%> also. He called its <S%H8034><s%> name Sitnah. <S%H7856><s%>

He left <S%H6275><s%> that place, <S%H2658><s%> and dug another <S%H312><s%> well. <S%H875><s%> They didn't <S%H7378><s%> argue over that one. <S%H7121><s%> He called it <S%H8034><s%> Rehoboth. <S%H7344><s%> He said, <S%H559><s%> "For now <S%H6258><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> has made room <S%H7337><s%> for us, <S%H6509><s%> and we will be fruitful in the land. <S%H776><s%>"
He went up <S%H5927><s%> from there to Beersheba. <S%H884><s%>

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> appeared <S%H7200><s%> to him the same night, <S%H3915><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "I am the God <S%H430><s%> of Abraham <S%H85><s%> your father. <S%H1><s%> Don't <S%H3372><s%> be afraid, for I am with <S%H854><s%> you, <S%H1288><s%> and will bless you, <S%H7235><s%> and multiply your seed <S%H2233><s%> for my servant <S%H5650><s%> Abraham <S%H85><s%>'s sake."

He built <S%H1129><s%> an altar <S%H4196><s%> there, <S%H7121><s%> and called on the name <S%H8034><s%> of Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> and pitched <S%H5186><s%> his tent <S%H168><s%> there. <S%H3327><s%> There Isaac's servants <S%H5650><s%> dug <S%H3738><s%> a well. <S%H875><s%>

Then Abimelech <S%H40><s%> went <S%H1980><s%> to him from Gerar, <S%H1642><s%> and Ahuzzath <S%H276><s%> his friend, <S%H4828><s%> and Phicol <S%H6369><s%> the captain <S%H8269><s%> of his army. <S%H6635><s%>
Isaac <S%H3327><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H4069><s%> "Why have you come <S%H935><s%> to me, <S%H8130><s%> since you hate me, <S%H7971><s%> and have sent me away from you?"

They said, <S%H559><s%> "We saw <S%H7200><s%> plainly <S%H7200><s%> that Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> was with you. <S%H559><s%> We said, <S%H423><s%> 'Let there now be an oath between <S%H996><s%> us, <S%H996><s%> even between us and you, <S%H3772><s%> and let us make a covenant with you, <S%H1285><s%>

that you will do <S%H6213><s%> us no harm, <S%H7451><s%> as we have not touched <S%H5060><s%> you, <S%H6213><s%> and as we have done to you nothing but <S%H7535><s%> good, <S%H2896><s%> and have sent you away <S%H7971><s%> in peace. <S%H7965><s%>' You are now <S%H6258><s%> the blessed <S%H1288><s%> of Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%>"
He made <S%H6213><s%> them a feast, <S%H4960><s%> and they ate <S%H398><s%> and drank. <S%H8354><s%>

They rose up some time <S%H7925><s%> in the morning, <S%H1242><s%> and swore <S%H7650><s%> one <S%H376><s%> to another. <S%H251><s%> Isaac <S%H3327><s%> sent them away, <S%H7971><s%> and they departed <S%H3212><s%> from him in peace. <S%H7965><s%>

It happened the same day, <S%H3117><s%> that Isaac <S%H3327><s%>'s servants <S%H5650><s%> came, <S%H935><s%> and told <S%H5046><s%> him concerning <S%H182><s%> the well <S%H875><s%> which they had dug, <S%H2658><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H4672><s%> "We have found water. <S%H4325><s%>"
He called <S%H7121><s%> it Shibah. <S%H7656><s%> Therefore the name <S%H8034><s%> of the city <S%H5892><s%> is Beersheba <S%H884><s%> to this day. <S%H3117><s%>

When Esau <S%H6215><s%> was forty <S%H705><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old, <S%H1121><s%> he took <S%H3947><s%> as wife <S%H802><s%> Judith, <S%H3067><s%> the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Beeri <S%H882><s%> the Hittite, <S%H2850><s%> and Basemath, <S%H1315><s%> the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Elon <S%H356><s%> the Hittite. <S%H2850><s%>
They grieved <S%H4786><s%> Isaac <S%H3327><s%>'s and Rebekah <S%H7259><s%>'s spirits. <S%H7307><s%>
